page.title: 10Farming in New Mill Area.
page.content: The area lies near the Eastern slopes of the Pennines. It is a rolling landscape of hills and valleys.The nature of farming in the district is much affected by the height of the land.A good walk around the area on one of the many public foot-paths shows how the vegetation is affected by altitude. The highest land is usually coarse grass with poor soil.As you drop into the valley soil becomes richer and the grass improves. On the higher ground there is grazing for sheep.Lower down we find beef cattle.On the lower valley slopes are dairy herds.In the valley bottom are both dairy herds and some crop growing.The principle crop is often grass for winter fodder.Occasionally specialised farms i.e.pig or poultry farms can be found but these are rare.
